message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper discusses a technique for content fragmentation in Content-Centric Networking (CCN) and specifically in Named-Data Networking (NDN), which is a candidate Future Internet Architecture. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses security guarantees and assesses performance, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper involves designing a concrete technique and assessing performance, which could place it in cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
